channel.title: Harddrive transfer, need the smart pplz of mopar here!
channel.description: HI GUYZ :) i wanna know what will happen if i transfer my harddrive from my older computer with an existing windows installation to another computer with different hardware. thanks for help, and no BS from dumb ass spammers. and if this is wrong section(which im sure it isnt), plz point me to the rite section. THANK YEW!!

item.title: Harddrive transfer, need the smart pplz of mopar here!
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:12, topic:130980”][quote author=Mattymat1313 link=topic=181686.msg1659330#msg1659330 date=1186539583]
define what u mean by “re-activation” plz
[/quote]

Windows is gay, so it uses anti-piracy technology which requires you to either activate your copy via internet or telephone, and if you choose the latter it may require your CD key, so hopefully you didn’t loose that.

I don’t think you can activate the same copy via internet if you’ve activated it on another machine with a different hardware setup, so you may be forced to activate by telephone.[/quote]
Orrr you could be like me and crack it

Read full topic
item.source: Harddrive transfer, need the smart pplz of mopar here!

item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Mattymat1313:

define what u mean by “re-activation” plz

Windows is gay, so it uses anti-piracy technology which requires you to either activate your copy via internet or telephone, and if you choose the latter it may require your CD key, so hopefully you didn’t loose that.

I don’t think you can activate the same copy via internet if you’ve activated it on another machine with a different hardware setup, so you may be forced to activate by telephone.

item.description:

Mattymat1313:

But the difference in processors is the old one was 300mghrz and the new one ima put the old harddrive in is 2.00ghrz. would this be ok?

It should be fine, though for future reference, it’s a MHz and GHz.

item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Depends on how different the hardware is, if it’s similar it should boot but some thing may not work correctly and if they are really different it wont boot at all do to hardware and driver conflicts
